newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh tea prices fall at weekly auction.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh tea prices fall at weekly auction.

text.p: Bangladeshi tea prices fell for the second week running at Tuesday's auction, mainly due to lack of overseas demand and poor quality end-of-season teas, brokers said.
Brokers said buyers for Poland were active but Pakistan and Afghanistan kept to the sidelines. Lack of interest forced traders to withdraw 31.26 percent of offers.

Some 584,290 kgs were sold at the auction at an average price of 53.68 taka per kg, 0.79 taka down from the previous sale. The next sale will be on March 11 with an expected offer of 715,000 kg of teas. ($1 = 42.75 taka)
